item.title: Veerle add a quote by Carlos Ruiz Zafón
item.description: "The moment you stop to think about whether you love someone, you've already stopped loving that person forever." -- Carlos Ruiz Zafón

item.title: Veerle add a quote by Carlos Ruiz Zafon
item.description: "Paris is the only city in the world where starving to death is still considered an art." -- Carlos Ruiz Zafon

item.title: Veerle add a quote by Carlos Ruiz Zafón
item.description: "People talk too much. Humans aren't descended from monkeys. They come from parrots." -- Carlos Ruiz Zafón

item.title: Veerle add a quote by Carlos Ruiz Zafon
item.description: "I told her how until that moment I had not understood that this was a story about lonely people, about absence and loss, and that that was why I had taken refuge in it until it became confused with my own life, like someone who has escaped into the pages of a novel because those whom he needs to love seem nothing more than ghosts inhabiting the mind of a stranger." -- Carlos Ruiz Zafon

item.title: Veerle add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description: "It was at that age that poetry came in search of me." -- Pablo Neruda

item.title: Veerle add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description: "I can write the saddest poem of all tonight. I loved her, and sometimes she loved me too." -- Pablo Neruda

item.title: Veerle add a quote by Jack Kerouac
item.description: "A pain stabbed my heart, as it did every time I saw a girl I loved who was going the opposite direction in this too-big world." -- Jack Kerouac

item.title: Veerle add a quote by Jack Kerouac
item.description: "I'm going to marry my novels and have little short stories for children." -- Jack Kerouac

item.title: Veerle add a quote by Gabriel García Márquez
item.description: "She would defend herself, saying that love, no matter what else it might be, was a natural talent. She would say: You are either born knowing how, or you never know." -- Gabriel García Márquez

item.title: Veerle add a quote by Gabriel García Márquez
item.description: "He is ugly and sad... but he is all love." -- Gabriel García Márquez

item.title: Veerle add a quote by Harper Lee
item.description: "Until I feared I would lose it, I never loved to read. One does not love breathing." -- Harper Lee
